title: SystemVerilog ALU Design and Verification
description: Designed a SystemVerilog Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU) implementing a RISC-V–style RV32I instruction set architecture (ISA) including ADD, SUB, AND, OR, XOR, and SLT similar to ALU operations used in modern RISC-V decoders.
fullDescription: Built a modular RV32I ALU covering ADD, SUB, AND, OR, XOR, shift, and SLT operations.
Wrote synthesizable SystemVerilog mirroring modern RISC-style decoder behavior.
Verified functionality inside Questa with constrained-random sequences and coverage checks.
challenges: Integrating multimodal data sources and ensuring accurate cross-modal retrieval while maintaining low latency for real-time recommendations.
learnings: Gained hands-on experience with AWS cloud services, vector databases, and the practical implementation of RAG architectures for production use cases.

title: VHDL 4-Bit Calculator with Testbenching and FSM Design
description: Produced and implemented a 4-bit calculator on FPGA using VHDL, supporting addition and accumulator clear (AC) operations with finite state machine (FSM) control logic.
fullDescription: Implemented a 4-bit calculator FSM in VHDL with ADD and accumulator-clear behaviors.
Built a self-checking VHDL testbench and inspected timing in Vivado waveforms.
Targeted an FPGA board with a custom constraints file for switches, LEDs, and the clock.
challenges: Ensuring fault-tolerant execution and maintaining data consistency across distributed systems while processing real-time streaming data at scale.
learnings: Developed deep expertise in building end-to-end big data pipelines, orchestrating distributed workflows, and creating actionable insights through data visualization.

title: Interactive Embedded Prop: Motion-Activated Detonator
description: Fabricated an interactive detonator prop that combines embedded systems, 3D design, and software engineering through the use of a custom designed PCB along with experience in designing and prototyping.
fullDescription: Prototyped a motion-activated detonator prop on a custom PCB.
Integrated sensors, LEDs, and a DFPlayer Mini audio module directly on the board.
Blended embedded firmware, enclosure design, and iterative fabrication workflows.
challenges: Processing and cleansing 1M+ rows of sensor data with varying quality levels while implementing effective outlier detection algorithms.
learnings: Mastered the Medallion architecture pattern for data lakes and gained proficiency in Azure cloud services and advanced Power BI dashboard development.

title: Shelf of Health: Food Processing Visualization
description: Visualization mapping grocery store shelves by food processing levels, revealing that even 'healthy' stores mainly stock ultra-processed foods.
fullDescription: Won Best Project by turning NOVA food-processing data into a physical shelf story.
Used Excel and Python to classify grocery items by processing level.
Revealed that even 'healthy' stores stock mostly ultra-processed products.
challenges: Creating an intuitive and engaging visualization that effectively communicates complex nutritional data to a general audience.
learnings: Learned the importance of visual storytelling in data science and how creative presentation can make data insights more accessible and impactful.

title: Exoplanet
description: Visualizes exoplanet data using interactive maps.
fullDescription: Visualizes confirmed exoplanets with interactive D3 maps and charts.
Explores the TOI catalog through a GitHub-hosted data workflow.

title: Culinary Trends Analysis
description: Uses machine learning and statistical testing on 84K Food.com recipes to explore how cuisine type affects ratings.
fullDescription: Analyzed 84K Food.com recipes to connect cuisine types with rating trends.
Engineered structured features and applied SMOTE to balance training data.
Ran multiple classifiers plus statistical tests to validate the insights.
challenges: Handling class imbalance in the dataset and extracting meaningful features from unstructured recipe data.
learnings: Gained experience in feature engineering, dealing with imbalanced datasets using SMOTE, and applying statistical methods to validate machine learning findings.
